Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2009 09:11PM RockiesGirl wrote: Hi Everyone! Thanks for checking up on me.  I had the surgery on Wednesday and it went so smoothly!!  My best friend took me to the hospital, and stayed with me right up until they took me to the operating room.  The nurses were all angels and the anesthesiologist was super nice as well.  The last thing I remember was when the anesthesiologist walked in the room and was behind me messing with something and I asked him, "Did you do something to me?  Because I am starting to feel drunk!"  Then I woke up in recovery!  It was such a relief to have it over with.  They loaded me up with painkillers and it didn't hurt at all until the second day.  Everything went so great!  I couldn't be more pleased.  I can't see the incision area yet because it is covered in dressing, but from what I can see, it looks pretty good!  Now the hard part is the waiting!  I meet with the surgeon for followup and to discuss the pathology on Tuesday the 29th.  Already my mind is reeling again!  But after the surgery went so well, I know I shouldn't be worried.  Everything will be ok, whether it is benign or not!    If I keep saying it to myself, I am hoping it will become true!! Thanks again ladies!  I don't know what I would do without you!

Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2009 08:00AM RockiesGirl wrote: Thanks for the responses, ladies!  There is so much to think about with all of this.  I will definitely call Monday and see if they can get me in any sooner.  My boss has been really supportive and will let me off work if I have to change appointment times.  I never thought of the possibility of the area "filing in".  That is somewhat of a comfort, and hopefully the surgeon is experienced enough to know at least somewhat what I can expect.  That is my main concern.  I think after I have talked with the surgeon and have learned more what I can expect, or what she recommends, I will feel much better.  It is so much easier to worry about one thing than to worry about all of the what-if's! Thanks to you guys though.  It is so nice to have an "insider's" voice!
